conclusion: Liquids are released from points A, B, C, and D and flow downward interacting with baffles.
Liquid from A flows straight down and hits the blue baffle.
The blue baffle directs the liquid from A to the red baffle.
The red baffle directs the liquid from A further downward into container F.
Liquid from B flows straight down and hits the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid from B to the red baffle.
The red baffle directs the liquid from B further downward into container F.
Liquid from C flows straight down and hits the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid from C to the red baffle.
The red baffle directs the liquid from C further downward into container F.
Liquid from D flows straight down and hits the green baffle.
The green baffle directs the liquid from D to the brown baffle.
The brown baffle directs the liquid from D further downward into container E.
Liquids from A, B, and C all flow into container F.
Liquid from D flows into container E.
The liquid will flow into both containers E and F.
Container E receives liquid from D.
Container F receives liquid from A, B, and C.
